short_summary: Software engineering support for EDC Treasury’s Cincom VisualWorks development platform and Universal Finance Server (UFS) application.
description: The Treasury Group and Corporate Banking, along with other financial departments at EDC rely heavily on UFS, a legacy system which has been in use for over two decades. It has been customized extensively and is used to record, manage, control, and facilitate execution of specific financial transactions. This allows the enterprise to monitor and maintain critical liquidity ratios and manage interest and foreign exchange risk and requires access to relevant market data. UFS requires constant IT maintenance. The contract is for software engineering support for Cincom VisualWorks development platform and Universal Finance Server (UFS) application.
full_summary:
# Advance Contract Award Notice

## Notice Details
| Description | Value |
| --- | --- |
| Title | Cincom VisualWorks Software Engineering Support |
| Reference Number | cb-483-1187321 |
| Amendment Number | 1 |
| Solicitation Number | 24-808 |
| Publication Date | 2024-04-26 |
| Tender Closing Date | 2024-05-16T13:00:00Z |
| Amendment Date | 2024-05-16 |
| Tender Status | Expired |

## Contract Details
Excluded from trade agreements: Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA)

### Regions of Delivery
National Capital Region (NCR)

### Contracting Entity
Export Development Canada (EDC)

#### Contact Information
* Name: Pat Sheehan
* Email: [psheehan@edc.ca](mailto:psheehan@edc.ca)
* Phone: (343) 572-6687

## Tender Description
PDF attachments are available on the following links:
* English: <https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/36993/acan-24-808_0.pdf>
* French: <https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/36993/pac-24-808_0.pdf>

The following services are required:

* Software engineering support for EDC Treasury’s Cincom VisualWorks development platform.
* Maintenance of the Universal Finance Server (UFS) application.

The UFS is a legacy system that has been used for over two decades and requires constant IT maintenance. The system is used to record, manage, control, and facilitate the execution of financial transactions, including monitoring critical liquidity ratios and managing interest and foreign exchange risk.

## Classification
* UNSPSC: 43232400 (Development software) and 80101507 (Information technology consultation services)
* Procurement Category: SRV
* Notice Type: Advance Contract Award Notice

Note: UNSPSC is an open standard for IT classification. The Procurement Category is SRV (Services). The Notice Type is an Advance Contract Award Notice, indicating that an agreement has been reached between the supplier and the contracting authority. 

This rewritten entry removes irrelevant information, structures the text in a more logical and easy-to-read format, and rephrases the parts where necessary. The output is approximately 380
